meanings.definition: A long narrow hilltop, mountain range, or watershed.
meanings.sent1: The hikers reached the ridgel after a challenging climb.
meanings.sent2: The ridgel offered stunning views of the valley below.
meanings.sent3: The sheep enjoyed grazing along the ridgel, feeling like kings of the hill.
meanings.sent4: The ridgel of trees stood tall against the backdrop of the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The ridgel was a natural lookout point for spotting wildlife in the distance.

meanings.definition: To form into or along a ridge.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used a tractor to ridgel the field for better irrigation.
meanings.sent2: The workers ridgel the soil to prevent erosion on the slope.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to ridgel the sandcastle for added decoration.
meanings.sent4: The artist carefully ridgelled the clay to create a textured effect.
meanings.sent5: The gardener planned to ridgel the garden beds for improved drainage.

meanings.definition: A raised strip or border of something.
meanings.sent1: The cake was decorated with a ridgel of frosting along the edges.
meanings.sent2: The ridgel of snow along the driveway made it difficult to drive out.
meanings.sent3: The ridgel of books on the shelf threatened to topple over.
meanings.sent4: The ridgel of clouds on the horizon signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The ridgel of sand marked the boundary between the beach and the dunes.
